statement:
Let $\tilde{\lambda}$ be a complex number and $\tilde{u}$ be a vector
with $ \Vert\tilde{u}\Vert _p = 1$, and let
$r = A \tilde{u} - \tilde{\lambda} \tilde{u}$ (usually,
$\tilde{\lambda}$ and $\tilde{u}$ are considered to be approximation of
an eigenvalue and of an eigenvector of $A$). Assume $A$ is
diagonalizable and $A = XDX^{-1}$, with $D$ a diagonal matrix. Then the
matrix $A$ has an eigenvalue $\lambda$ which satisfies the inequality:
$$|\lambda - \tilde{\lambda}| \leq \kappa_p(X) \|r\|_p$$
